title: How much better is an audiobook narrated by the author? - Quora

response.answer_text: Agree with the other commenter that it’s great when someone reads his/her own autobiography. In fact, I find it a little disconcerting when it’s not ready by the author, especially if you already know what that person sounds like. However, most of the authors are terrible narrators, such as Stephen King. The only author I can think of who’s an excellent narrator is Malcolm Gladwell – in fact I would say his voice and conviction adds to experience. Be sure to always listen to the audio samples on audible.com, bad narration not only detracts from the book but sometimes makes it completely unlistenable. If you’ve listened to enough audiobooks you realize that narration is a serious craft and not everyone can “just do it”.
Some authors do a good job of reading their books aloud, but for the most part they should leave it to the professionals.
